_header: Bare was that white breast / And red the bloody side
Note: For other versions, in four long lines, see 3617 and 6540.5.
_description: Augustine’s Candet nudatum pectus — three quatrains

NLS18721.First Lines:
Bare was þat quite brest& red þe blodi
                    sideþe bodi stark als þu wel sestþe armes spred out
                    wyde…
NLS18721.Last Lines:
…þe feet ben þirled an torentand stremen al on
                    blode
NLS18721.Note: Written as couplets with medial rhyme.
NLS18721.Editions:
Woolf,  Rosemary. 
             The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1968: 30.
